member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIChannel.PerformBridgeOffsetNullingCalibration
member.summary: Performs a bridge offset nulling calibration on the virtual channels in the task. An error will occur if not all virtual channels in the task support this operation.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIChannel.PerformBridgeOffsetNullingCalibration(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs a bridge offset nulling calibration on the virtual channels in the task.
member.param: Specifies whether or not to skip channels that do not support shunt calibration. If skipUnsupportedChannels (parameter) is true, shunt calibration will be performed only on supported virtual channels in the task. If false, shunt calibration will be performed on all virtual channels in the task, which may result in an error if not all channels support shunt calibration.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIChannel.PerformStrainShuntCalibration(System.Double,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ShuntElementLocation,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs shunt calibration for the virtual channels in the task using a strain gage sensor.
member.param: Specifies the shunt resistance, in ohms.
Specifies the location of the shunt resistor.

Specifies whether or not to skip channels that do not support shunt calibration. If skipUnsupportedChannels (parameter) is true, shunt calibration will be performed only on supported virtual channels in the task. If false, shunt calibration will be performed on all virtual channels in the task, which may result in an error if not all channels support shunt calibration.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIChannel.PerformThermocoupleLeadOffsetNullingCalibration(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs thermocouple lead offset nulling calibration on the channels in the task to compensate for offsets introduced by open thermocouple detection. Use this method to specify whether or not to skip channels that do not support calibration.
member.param: Specifies whether or not to skip channels that do not support calibration. If skipUnsupportedChannels (parameter) is true, calibration will be performed only on supported virtual channels in the task. If false, calibration will be performed on all virtual channels in the task, which may result in an error if not all channels support calibration.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIChannel.PerformThermocoupleLeadOffsetNullingCalibration

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIChannel.BridgeInitialVoltage
member.summary: Specifies in volts the output voltage of the bridge while not under load. NI-DAQmx subtracts this value from any measurements before applying scaling equations. If you set BridgeInitialRatio, NI-DAQmx coerces this property to BridgeInitialRatio times ExcitationActualValue. This property is set by DAQmx Perform Bridge Offset Nulling Calibration. If you set this property, NI-DAQmx coerces BridgeInitialRatio to the value of this property divided by ExcitationActualValue. If you set both this property and BridgeInitialRatio, and their values conflict, NI-DAQmx returns an error. To avoid this error, reset one property to its default value before setting the other.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIChannel.BridgeInitialRatio
member.summary: Specifies in volts per volt the ratio of output voltage from the bridge to excitation voltage supplied to the bridge while not under load. NI-DAQmx subtracts this value from any measurements before applying scaling equations. If you set BridgeInitialVoltage, NI-DAQmx coerces this property to BridgeInitialVoltage divided by ExcitationActualValue. If you set this property, NI-DAQmx coerces BridgeInitialVoltage to the value of this property times ExcitationActualValue. If you set both this property and BridgeInitialVoltage, and their values conflict, NI-DAQmx returns an error. To avoid this error, reset one property to its default value before setting the other.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIChannel.LowpassSwitchedCapacitorExternalClockFrequency

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AOChannel.ReglitchEnable
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable reglitching. The output of a DAC normally glitches whenever the DAC is updated with a new value. The amount of glitching differs from code to code and is generally largest at major code transitions. Reglitching generates uniform glitch energy at each code transition and provides for more uniform glitches. Uniform glitch energy makes it easier to filter out the noise introduced from glitching during spectrum analysis.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DIChannel.DigitalFilterEnable
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable the digital filter for the line(s) or port(s). You can enable the filter on a line-by-line basis. You do not have to enable the filter for all lines in a channel.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DIChannel.DigitalFilterMinimumPulseWidth
member.summary: Specifies in seconds the minimum pulse width the filter recognizes as a valid high or low state transition.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DIChannel.DigitalFilterEnableBusMode
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable bus mode for digital filtering. If you set this property to true, NI-DAQmx treats all lines that use common filtering settings as a bus. If any line in the bus has jitter, all lines in the bus hold state until the entire bus stabilizes, or until 2 times the minimum pulse width elapses. If you set this property to false, NI-DAQmx filters all lines individually. Jitter in one line does not affect other lines.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DIChannel.DigitalFilterTimebaseSource
member.summary: Specifies the terminal of the signal to use as the timebase of the digital filter.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DIChannel.DigitalFilterTimebaseRate
member.summary: Specifies in hertz the rate of the digital filter timebase. NI-DAQmx uses this value to compute settings for the filter.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DIChannel.DigitalSynchronizationEnable
member.summary: Specifies whether to synchronize recognition of transitions in the signal to the internal timebase of the device.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DIChannel.Tristate
member.summary: Specifies whether to tristate the lines in the channel. If you set this property to true, NI-DAQmx tristates the lines in the channel. If you set this property to false, NI-DAQmx does not modify the configuration of the lines even if the lines were previously tristated. Set this property to false to read lines in other tasks or to read output-only lines.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIChannel.MemoryMappingEnable
member.summary: Specifies for NI-DAQmx to map hardware registers to the memory space of the application, if possible. Normally, NI-DAQmx maps hardware registers to memory accessible only to the kernel. Mapping the registers to the memory space of the application increases performance. However, if the application accesses the memory space mapped to the registers, it can adversely affect the operation of the device and possibly result in a system crash.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIChannel.NumberPossiblyInvalidSamples
member.summary: Indicates the number of samples that the device might have overwritten before it could transfer them to the buffer.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIChannel.DuplicateCountPrevention
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable duplicate count prevention for the channel. Duplicate count prevention is enabled by default. Setting Prescaler disables duplicate count prevention unless you explicitly enable it.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIChannel.Prescaler
member.summary: Specifies the divisor to apply to the signal you connect to the counter source terminal. Scaled data that you read takes this setting into account. You should use a prescaler only when you connect an external signal to the counter source terminal and when that signal has a higher frequency than the fastest onboard timebase. Setting this value disables duplicate count prevention unless you explicitly set DuplicateCountPrevention to true.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.COChannel.PulseDone
member.summary: Indicates if the task completed pulse generation. Use this value for retriggerable pulse generation when you need to determine if the device generated the current pulse. For retriggerable tasks, when you query this property, NI-DAQmx resets it to false.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.COChannel.EnableInitialDelayOnRetrigger
member.summary: Specifies whether to apply the initial delay to retriggered pulse trains.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.COChannel.ConstrainedGenerationMode
member.summary: Specifies constraints to apply when the counter generates pulses. Constraining the counter reduces the device resources required for counter operation. Constraining the counter can also allow additional analog or counter tasks on the device to run concurrently. For continuous counter tasks, NI-DAQmx consumes no device resources when the counter is constrained. For finite counter tasks, resource use increases with the frequency regardless of the constraint mode. However, fixed frequency constraints significantly reduce resource usage, and fixed duty cycle constraint marginally reduces it.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.COChannel.UseOnlyOnBoardMemory
member.summary: Specifies whether to write samples directly to the onboard memory of the device, bypassing the memory buffer. Generally, you cannot update onboard memory directly after you start the task. Onboard memory includes data FIFOs.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.COChannel.DataTransferMechanism
member.summary: Specifies the data transfer mode for the device. For buffered operations, use DMA or USB Bulk. For non-buffered operations, use Polled.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.COChannel.DataTransferRequestCondition
member.summary: Specifies under what condition to transfer data from the buffer to the onboard memory of the device.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.COChannel.UsbTransferRequestSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximum size of a USB transfer request in bytes. Modify this value to affect performance under different combinations of operating system and device.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.COChannel.MemoryMappingEnable
member.summary: Specifies for NI-DAQmx to map hardware registers to the memory space of the application, if possible. Normally, NI-DAQmx maps hardware registers to memory accessible only to the kernel. Mapping the registers to the memory space of the application increases performance. However, if the application accesses the memory space mapped to the registers, it can adversely affect the operation of the device and possibly result in a system crash.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.COChannel.Prescaler
member.summary: Specifies the divisor to apply to the signal you connect to the counter source terminal. Pulse generations defined by frequency or time take this setting into account, but pulse generations defined by ticks do not. You should use a prescaler only when you connect an external signal to the counter source terminal and when that signal has a higher frequency than the fastest onboard timebase.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.Timing
member.summary: Contains properties and methods that configure the sample timing and duration of the Task.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.Timing.ConfigureSampleClock(System.String,System.Double,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleClockActiveEdge,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleQuantityMode,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the source of the sample clock, the rate of the sample clock, and the number of samples to acquire or generate.
member.param: The source terminal of the clock. To use the internal clock of the device, set this value to Empty.
The sampling rate in samples per second. If you use an external source for the sample clock, set this input to the maximum expected rate of that clock.
The edges of sample clock pulses on which to acquire or generate samples.

The duration of the task. A task is either finite and stops once the specified number of samples have been acquired or generated, or it is continuous and continues to acquire or generate samples until the task is explicitly stopped.
The number of samples to acquire or generate if sampleMode (parameter) is FiniteSamples. If sample mode is ContinuousSamples, NI-DAQmx uses this value to determine the buffer size.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.Timing.ConfigureHandshaking(NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleQuantityMode,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines the sample timing and duration of the task with the specified number of samples, using standard 8255/82C55 digital handshaking between the device and a peripheral device.
member.param: The duration of the task. A task is either finite and stops once the specified number of samples has been acquired or generated, or it is continuous and continues to acquire or generate samples until the task is explicitly stopped.

The number of samples to acquire or generate for each channel in the task if sampleMode (parameter) is FiniteSamples. If sampleMode (parameter) is ContinuousSamples, NI-DAQmx uses this value to determine the buffer size.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.Timing.ConfigureImplicit(NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleQuantityMode,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets only the duration of the task and the number of samples to acquire or generate without specifying timing.
member.param: The duration of the task. A task is either finite and stops once the specified number of samples have been acquired or generated, or it is continuous and continues to acquire or generate samples until the task is explicitly stopped.

The number of samples to acquire or generate for each channel in the task if sampleMode (parameter) is FiniteSamples. For finite counter output tasks, samplesPerChannel (parameter) is the number of pulses to generate. If sample mode is ContinuousSamples, NI-DAQmx uses this value to determine the buffer size.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.Timing.ChangeDetectionDITristate
member.summary: Specifies whether to tristate lines specified with ChangeDetectionDIRisingEdgePhysicalChannels and ChangeDetectionDIFallingEdgePhysicalChannels that are not in a virtual channel in the task. If you set this property to true, NI-DAQmx tristates rising/falling edge lines that are not in a virtual channel in the task. If you set this property to false, NI-DAQmx does not modify the configuration of rising/falling edge lines that are not in a virtual channel in the task, even if the lines were previously tristated. Set this property to false to detect changes on lines in other tasks or to detect changes on output-only lines.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.StartTrigger.Retriggerable

member.summary: Configures the task to stop the acquisition when the device acquires all pretrigger samples; an analog signal enters or leaves a range you specify; and the device acquires all post-trigger samples.
member.param: The name of a virtual channel or terminal where there is an analog signal to use as the source of the trigger. For E Series devices, if you use a virtual channel, it must be the only channel in the task. The only terminal you can use for E Series devices is PFI0.

The upper limit of the voltage window, in the units of the measurement or generation.
The lower limit of the voltage window, in the units of the measurement or generation.
The minimum number of samples per channel to acquire before recognizing the reference trigger.

The slope of the signal on which the reference trigger occurs.
The threshold, in the units of the measurement or generation, to trigger. Use slope (parameter) to specify on which slope to trigger at this threshold.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.Task.ConfigureLogging(System.String,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TdmsLoggingOperation,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.LoggingMode)
member.summary: Configures logging to a .tdms file when the acquisition starts.
member.param: The path to the .tdms file to which you want to log data. If you use this method to create a new file, the file extension of the filename you specify in filePath (parameter) must be .tdms. Otherwise, this method automatically appends .tdms to the filename you specify. If you use this method to open or update an existing file, you do not have to ensure that the file extension is .tdms.
A TdmsLoggingOperation value that specifies how to open the .tdms file.
A LoggingMode value that specifies how to log data.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.Task.ConfigureLogging(System.String,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TdmsLoggingOperation,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.LoggingMode,System.String)
member.summary: Configures logging to a .tdms file when the acquisition starts with the specified TDMS channel group name.
member.param: The path to the .tdms file to which you want to log data. If you use this method to create a new file, the file extension of the filename you specify in filePath (parameter) must be .tdms. Otherwise, this method automatically appends .tdms to the filename you specify. If you use this method to open or update an existing file, you do not have to ensure that the file extension is .tdms.
A TdmsLoggingOperation value which specifies how to open the .tdms file.
A LoggingMode value which specifies how to log data.

The name of the channel group to create within the .tdms file for data from this task. When set to null, Empty, or a string with only white space, the driver sets the TDMS channel group name to the task name.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqSystem.ConnectSwitchChannels(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes one or more connections between switch channels as specified by the connection list.
member.param: A list of connections to make between switch channels. This list uses a special syntax.

If true, this method waits for the switches to settle before returning. If false, the method returns immediately after the operation. This settling time is controlled through the SettlingTime property.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqSystem.SetDevicePowerUpState(System.String,System.String[],NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalPowerUpState[])
member.summary: Updates the power up states to which to set digital physical channels on a device when the device powers up or when you reset the device.
member.param: The name, as configured in Measurement Automation Explorer (MAX), of the device to which this operation applies.

The digital lines or ports for which to set new power up states. Each value in this array specifies a virtual channel string that is assigned the power up state at the corresponding position in the powerUpStates (parameter) parameter. You cannot set power up states for dedicated digital input lines. You can specify a string that contains a list or range of digital lines or ports.
The physical channels and power up states to set. Each value in this array applies to the virtual channel name at the corresponding position of the virtualChannels (parameter) parameter.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqSystem.SetDevicePowerUpState(System.String,System.String[],System.Double[],System.String[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Updates the power up states to which to set analog physical channels on a device when the device powers up or when you reset the device.
member.param: The name, as configured in Measurement Automation Explorer (MAX), of the device to which this operation applies.

The voltage channels for which to set new power up values. Each value in this array specifies a virtual channel string that is assigned the voltage at the corresponding position in the voltageValues (parameter) parameter. You can set voltage power up states only for physical channels that support voltage output.

The voltages to set. Each value in this array applies to the virtual channel name at the corresponding position of the voltageChannels (parameter) parameter. You can set voltage power up states only for physical channels that support voltage output.

The current channels for which to set new power up values. Each value in this array specifies a virtual channel string that is assigned the current at the corresponding position in the currentValues (parameter) parameter. You can set current power up states only for physical channels that support current output.

The currents to set. Each value in this array applies to the virtual channel name at the corresponding position of the currentChannels (parameter) parameter. You can set current power up states only for physical channels that support current output.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqSystem.CreateWatchdogTimerTask(System.String,System.String,System.Double,System.String[],NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WatchdogDOExpirationState[])
member.summary: Creates a task to configure and control the watchdog timer of a static DIO device. The timer activates when you start the task.
member.param: The name of the task to create. If you specify Empty or null, the NI-DAQmx driver assigns a unique name to the new task.
The name of the device for which to create a watchdog timer task.

The amount of time in seconds until the watchdog timer expires. A value of -1 means the internal timer never expires. Set timeout (parameter) to -1 if you use an Expiration Trigger to expire the watchdog task.

The physical channel names for which to define watchdog expiration states. Each value in this vector specifies a physical channel string that is assigned the expiration state at the corresponding position in the expirationStates (parameter) parameter. You cannot modify the expiration state of dedicated digital input physical channels.
The state to which to set the digital physical channel when the watchdog timer expires.
member.returns: The Task that this method creates.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.PolynomialScale
member.summary: Encapsulates a custom scale that scales values by using an n^th-order polynomial equation.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.PolynomialScale.#ctor(System.String,System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the PolynomialScale class with the specified forward and reverse coefficients.
member.param: The name of the custom scale for later use, such as when you create a virtual channel.

The array of the forward coefficients of the polynomial. Each element of the array corresponds to a term of the equation. For example, if index three of the array is 9, the fourth term of the equation is 9x^3.

The array of the reverse coefficients of the polynomial. Each element of the array corresponds to a term of the equation. For example, if index three of the array is 9, the fourth term of the equation is 9y^3.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.PolynomialScale.#ctor(System.String,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.PolynomialDirection,System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the PolynomialScale class with the specified forward or reverse coefficients and automatically computes the other set of coefficients with the same order as the provided coefficients, using 1000 points in the specified range.
member.param: The name of the custom scale for later use, such as when you create a virtual channel.
The conversion direction of the specified polynomial. The opposite polynomial is computed by the PolynomialScale.

The array of coefficients of a polynomial. Each element of the array corresponds to a term of the equation. For example, if index three of the array is 9, the fourth term of the equation is 9x^3. This polynomial is used as either the forward or reverse polynomial depending on the direction specified.
The minimum of the range over which the polynomial specified is valid or of interest.
The maximum of the range over which the polynomial specified is valid or of interest.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.PolynomialScale.#ctor(System.String,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.PolynomialDirection,System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the PolynomialScale class with the specified forward or reverse coefficients and automatically computes the other set of coefficients.
member.param: The name of the custom scale for later use, such as when you create a virtual channel.
The conversion direction of the specified polynomial. The opposite polynomial is computed by the PolynomialScale.

The array of coefficients of a polynomial. Each element of the array corresponds to a term of the equation. For example, if index three of the array is 9, the fourth term of the equation is 9x^3. This polynomial is used as either the forward or reverse polynomial depending on the direction specified.
The minimum of the range over which the polynomial specified is valid or of interest.
The maximum of the range over which the polynomial specified is valid or of interest.
The number of points to evaluate for computing the polynomial of the opposite direction.
The order of polynomial to compute for the opposite polynomial to the one provided. Specify -1 to use the same order as the forward polynomial.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.PolynomialScale.ForwardCoefficients
member.summary: Specifies an array of coefficients for the polynomial that converts pre-scaled values to scaled values. Each element of the array corresponds to a term of the equation. For example, if index three of the array is 9, the fourth term of the equation is 9x^3.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.PolynomialScale.ReverseCoefficients
member.summary: Specifies an array of coefficients for the polynomial that converts scaled values to pre-scaled values. Each element of the array corresponds to a term of the equation. For example, if index three of the array is 9, the fourth term of the equation is 9y^3.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogLevelPauseTrigger.Hysteresis
member.summary: Specifies a hysteresis level in the units of the measurement or generation. If Condition is AboveLevel, the trigger does not deassert until the source signal passes below Level minus the hysteresis. If Condition is BelowLevel, the trigger does not deassert until the source signal passes above Level plus the hysteresis. Hysteresis is always enabled. Set this property to a non-zero value to use hysteresis.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogEdgeReferenceTrigger.Hysteresis
member.summary: Specifies a hysteresis level in the units of the measurement. If Slope is Rising, the trigger does not deassert until the source signal passes below Level minus the hysteresis. Set this property to a non-zero value to use hysteresis.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TaskAction
member.summary: Specifies how to alter the state of the task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TaskAction.Commit
member.summary: Programs the hardware with all parameters of the task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TaskAction.Start
member.summary: Transitions the task to the running state, which begins device input or output.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TaskAction.Unreserve
member.summary: Releases all previously reserved resources.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TaskAction.Reserve
member.summary: Marks the hardware resources that are needed for the task as in use. No other tasks can reserve these same resources.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TaskAction.Verify
member.summary: Verifies that all task parameters are valid for the hardware.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TaskAction.Stop
member.summary: Transitions the task from the running state to the committed state, which ends device input or output.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TaskAction.Abort
member.summary: Aborts execution of the task. Aborting a task immediately terminates the currently active operation, such as a read or a write. Aborting a task puts the task into an unstable but recoverable state. To recover the task, use Start to restart the task or use Stop to reset the task without starting it.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream.ReadRaw(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads raw, unprocessed samples from the channels in the task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set samplesPerChannel (parameter) to -1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set samplesPerChannel (parameter) to -1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the ReadAllAvailableSamples property of the DaqStream you are reading from.
member.returns: A byte array of raw data from the task.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream.ReadRelativeTo

If you also specify an offset with ReadOffset, the read operation begins at that offset relative to the point you select with this property. The default value is CurrentReadPosition unless you configure a Reference Trigger for the task. If you configure a Reference Trigger, the default value is FirstPretriggerSample.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream.ReadAllAvailableSamples
member.summary: Specifies whether subsequent read operations read all samples currently available in the buffer or wait for the buffer to become full before reading. NI-DAQmx uses this setting for finite acquisitions and only when the number of samples to read is -1. For continuous acquisitions when the number of samples to read is -1, a read operation always reads all samples currently available in the buffer.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream.ReadAutoStart
member.summary: Specifies if reading from the task automatically starts the task if you did not start the task explicitly by using starting the task. The default value is true. When reading from the task starts a finite acquisition task, it also stops the task after reading the last sample.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream.ReadOverwriteMode

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream.LoggingFilePath
member.summary: Specifies the path to the TDMS file to which you want to log data. If the file path is changed while the task is running, this takes effect on the next sample interval (if Logging.SampsPerFile has been set) or when DAQmx Start New File is called. New file paths can be specified by ending with "\" or "/". Files created after specifying a new file path retain the same name and numbering sequence.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream.LoggingMode
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable logging and whether to allow reading data while logging. Log mode allows for the best performance. However, you cannot read data while logging if you specify this mode. If you want to read data while logging, specify Log and Read mode.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream.TdmsLoggingGroupName
member.summary: Specifies the name of the group to create within the TDMS file for data from this task. If you append data to an existing file and the specified group already exists, NI-DAQmx appends a number symbol and a number to the group name, incrementing that number until finding a group name that does not exist. For example, if you specify a group name of Voltage Task, and that group already exists, NI-DAQmx assigns the group name Voltage Task #1, then Voltage Task #2.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream.TdmsLoggingOperation
member.summary: Specifies how to open the TDMS file.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream.LoggingPause
member.summary: Specifies whether logging is paused while a task is executing. If LoggingMode is set to Log and Read mode, this value is taken into consideration on the next call to DAQmx Read, where data is written to disk. If LoggingMode is set to Log Only mode, this value is taken into consideration the next time that data is written to disk. A new TDMS group is written when logging is resumed from a paused state.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream.LoggingSamplesPerFile
member.summary: Specifies how many samples to write to each file. When the file reaches the number of samples specified, a new file is created with the naming convention of <filename>_####.tdms, where #### starts at 0001 and increments automatically with each new file. For example, if the file specified is C:\data.tdms, the next file name used is C:\data_0001.tdms. To disable file spanning behavior, set this attribute to 0. If LoggingFilePath is changed while this attribute is set, the new file path takes effect on the next file created.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream.LoggingFileWriteSize
member.summary: Specifies the size, in samples, in which data will be written to disk. The size must be evenly divisible by the volume sector size, in bytes.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream.LoggingFilePreallocationSize
member.summary: Specifies a size in samples to be used to pre-allocate space on disk. Pre-allocation can improve file I/O performance, especially in situations where multiple files are being written to disk. For finite tasks, the default behavior is to pre-allocate the file based on the number of samples you configure the task to acquire.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream.TotalSamplesAcquiredPerChannel

member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream.CommonModeRangeErrorChannelsExist
member.summary: Indicates if the device(s) detected a common mode range violation for any virtual channel in the task. Common mode range violation occurs when the voltage of either the positive terminal or negative terminal to ground are out of range. Reading this property clears the common mode range violation status for all channels in the task. You must read this property before you read CommonModeRangeErrorChannels. Otherwise, you will receive an error.

member.param: If set to true this method automatically calls Start if you do not explicitly call it. You cannot set this parameter to true if you have installed events on the task.

A 1D array of samples to write to the task. Each element of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task.
An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the write is complete. Specify null if you do not want a callback when the write is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous write request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify null if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.

member.summary: Begins an asynchronous write of one or more analog waveform samples to one or more AOChannel objects in a task.
member.param: If you set autoStart to true, BeginWriteWaveform automatically calls Start if you do not explicitly call Start. You cannot set this parameter to true if you have installed events on the task.

A 1D array of AnalogWaveform<T> objects to write to the task. Each element in the array corresponds to a channel in the task. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task. The order of the lines in the analog waveform corresponds to the order in which you add the lines to the channel.
An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the write is complete. Specify null if you do not want a callback when the write is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous write request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify null if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.
member.typeparam: The type of the analog waveform samples.
member.returns: An IAsyncResult that represents the asynchronous call.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogMultiChannelReader.ReadSingleSample
member.summary: Reads a single floating-point sample from one or more AIChannel objects in a task.
member.returns: A 1D array of floating-point samples from the task. Each element in the array corresponds to a channel in the task. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in ChannelsToRead.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogMultiChannelReader.ReadMultiSample(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads one or more floating-point samples from one or more AIChannel objects in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set samplesPerChannel (parameter) to -1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set samplesPerChannel (parameter) to -1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the ReadAllAvailableSamples property of the DaqStream you are reading from.
member.returns: A 2D array of floating-point samples from the task. Each element in the first dimension of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. Each element in the second dimension of the array corresponds to a sample from each of the channels. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in ChannelsToRead.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogMultiChannelReader.MemoryOptimizedReadMultiSample(System.Int32,System.Double[0:,0:]@,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReallocationPolicy,System.Int32!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsLong@)
member.summary: Reads one or more floating-point samples from one or more AIChannel objects in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set samplesPerChannel (parameter) to - 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set samplesPerChannel (parameter) to - 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the ReadAllAvailableSamples property of the DaqStream you are reading from.

An existing 2D array of floating-point samples that contains the read data. Each element in the first dimension of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. Each element in the second dimension of the array corresponds to a sample from each of the channels. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in ChannelsToRead.
Dictates the reallocation behavior of the read operation. Refer to ReallocationPolicy for more information.
The actual number of samples per channel read. This is useful when the reading operation yields fewer samples than the actual length of data (parameter).
member.returns: A reference to the data (parameter) parameter containing samples from the task.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
The length of the dimensions of data (parameter) are inconsistent with either the number of channels of the task or samplesPerChannel (parameter).
There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogMultiChannelReader.MemoryOptimizedReadWaveform(System.Int32,NationalInstruments.AnalogWaveform{System.Double}[],NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReallocationPolicy)
member.summary: Reads one or more analog waveform samples from one or moreAIChannelobjects in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set samplesPerChannel (parameter) to - 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set samplesPerChannel (parameter) to - 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the ReadAllAvailableSamples property of the DaqStream you are reading from.

An existing 1D array of AnalogWaveform<T> that contains the read data. Each element in the array corresponds to a channel in the task. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in ChannelsToRead.
Dictates the reallocation behavior of the read operation. Refer to ReallocationPolicy for more information.
member.returns: A reference to the data (parameter) parameter containing samples from the task.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

This exception may be thrown due to one of the following conditions:
The capacity of each AnalogWaveform in data (parameter) is less than samplesPerChannel (parameter). This behavior is only present when policy (parameter) is set to DoNotReallocate.
The length of data (parameter) is inconsistent with the number of channels in the task.
There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.

If you set samplesPerChannel (parameter) to -1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the ReadAllAvailableSamples property of the DaqStreamyou are reading from.
An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the read is complete. Specify null if you do not want a callback when the read is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous read request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify null if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.

An existing 2D array of floating-point samples that contains the read data. Each element in the first dimension of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. Each element in the second dimension of the array corresponds to a sample from each of the channels. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in ChannelsToRead.
member.returns: A reference to the data (parameter) parameter containing samples from the task.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelWriter
member.summary: Contains methods for writing samples to one or more digital output channels in a task.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelWriter.#ctor(NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the DigitalMultiChannelWriter class to write to the specified DaqStream.
member.param: The DaqStream to write to.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelWriter.WriteSingleSampleSingleLine(System.Boolean,System.Boolean[])
member.summary: Writes a single Boolean sample to one or more DOChannel objects in a task.
member.param: If set to true this method automatically calls Start if you do not explicitly call it. You cannot set this parameter to true if you have installed events on the task.

A 1D array of Boolean samples to write to the task. Each element of the array corresponds to a channel within the task. The order of the channels in the array correspond to the order in which you add the channels to the task. The order of the lines in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the lines to the channel.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
data (parameter) has a non-zero lower bound.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelWriter.WriteSingleSampleMultiLine(System.Boolean,System.Boolean[0:,0:])

member.param: If set to true this method automatically calls Start if you do not explicitly call it. You cannot set this parameter to true if you have installed events on the task.

A 2D array of Boolean samples to write to the task. Each element in the first dimension of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. Each element in the second dimension of the array corresponds to a line in that channel. The order of the channels in the array correspond to the order in which you add the channels to the task. The order of the lines in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the lines to the channel.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.param: If set to true this method automatically calls Start if you do not explicitly call it. You cannot set this parameter to true if you have installed events on the task.
A sample to write to the task.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalSingleChannelWriter.WriteMultiSamplePort(System.Boolean,System.Int16[])
member.summary: Writes one or more 16-bit integer samples to a single DOChannel in a task.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalSingleChannelWriter.BeginWriteSingleSamplePort(System.Boolean,System.Int16,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous write of a single 16-bit integer sample to a single DOChannel in a task.
member.param: If set to true this method automatically calls Start if you do not explicitly call it. You cannot set this parameter to true if you have installed events on the task.
A sample to write to the task.
An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the write is complete. Specify null if you do not want a callback when the write is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous write request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify null if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.
member.returns: An IAsyncResult that represents the asynchronous call.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalSingleChannelWriter.WriteWaveform(System.Boolean,NationalInstruments.DigitalWaveform)
member.summary: Writes one or more digital waveform samples to a single DOChannel in a task.
member.param: If set to true this method automatically calls Start if you do not explicitly call it. You cannot set this parameter to true if you have installed events on the task.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelReader
member.summary: Contains methods for reading samples from one or more digital input or output channels in a task.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelReader.#ctor(NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the DigitalMultiChannelReader class to read from the specified DaqStream.
member.param: The DaqStream to read.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelReader.ReadSingleSampleSingleLine
member.summary: Reads a single Boolean sample from one or more DIChannel objects in a task. Each channel can contain a single digital line.
member.returns: A 1D array of Boolean samples from the task. Each element of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in ChannelsToRead.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelReader.ReadSingleSampleMultiLine
member.summary: Reads a single sample containing Boolean values from one or more DIChannel objects in a task. Each channel can contain multiple digital lines.
member.returns: A 2D array of Boolean samples from the task. Each element in the first dimension of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. Each element in the second dimension of the array corresponds to a line in that channel. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in ChannelsToRead.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelReader.ReadMultiSamplePortByte(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads one or more 8-bit unsigned integer samples from one or more DIChannel objects in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set samplesPerChannel (parameter) to -1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set samplesPerChannel (parameter) to -1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the ReadAllAvailableSamples property of the DaqStream you are reading from.
member.returns: A 2D array of 8-bit unsigned integer samples from the task. Each element in the first dimension of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. Each element in the second dimension of the array corresponds to a sample from each channel. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in ChannelsToRead.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelReader.BeginReadMultiSamplePortInt16(System.Int32,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous read of one or more 16-bit integer samples from one or more DIChannel objects in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set samplesPerChannel (parameter) to -1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set samplesPerChannel (parameter) to -1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the ReadAllAvailableSamples property of the DaqStream you are reading from.
An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the read is complete. Specify null if you do not want a callback when the read is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous read request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify null if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.

member.param: An IAsyncResult that represents an asynchronous call started by calling BeginReadMultiSamplePortInt16.
member.returns: A 2D array of 16-bit integer samples from the task. Each element in the first dimension of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. Each element in the second dimension of the array corresponds to a sample from each channel. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in ChannelsToRead.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalSingleChannelReader.BeginReadMultiSamplePortUInt16(System.Int32,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous read of one or more 16-bit unsigned integer samples from a single DIChannel in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set numberOfSamples (parameter) to -1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set numberOfSamples (parameter) to -1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the ReadAllAvailableSamples property of the DaqStream you are reading from.
An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the read is complete. Specify null if you do not want a callback when the read is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous read request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify null if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.
member.returns: An IAsyncResult that represents the asynchronous call.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIChannelCollection.CreateFrequencyVoltageChannel(System.String,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an AIChannel with the specified custom scale to measure frequency using a frequency-to-voltage converter. This method adds one or more physical channels to the AIChannelCollection.
member.param: The names of one or more physical channels to use to create one or more local virtual channels.
One or more names to assign to the created local virtual channels. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to Empty.
The minimum value expected from the measurement, in units.
The maximum value expected from the measurement, in units.

The voltage level at which to recognize waveform repetitions. You should select a voltage level that occurs only once within the entire period of a waveform. You also can select a voltage that occurs only once while the voltage rises or falls.

A window, in volts, below thresholdVoltage (parameter). The input voltage must pass below thresholdVoltage (parameter) minus hysteresis (parameter) before NI-DAQmx recognizes a waveform repetition. Hysteresis can improve the measurement accuracy when the signal contains noise or jitter.
The name of the custom scale to apply to the local virtual channel.
member.returns: The newly created AIChannel.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.summary: Creates an AIChannel with the specified custom scale to measure resistance. This method adds one or more physical channels to the AIChannelCollection.
member.param: The names of one or more physical channels to use to create one or more local virtual channels.
One or more names to assign to the created local virtual channels. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to Empty.
The minimum value expected from the measurement, in units.
The maximum value expected from the measurement, in units.
The number of wires to use for resistive measurements.
The source of excitation.
The amount of excitation in amperes that the sensor requires.
The name of the custom scale to apply to the local virtual channel.
member.returns: The newly created AIChannel.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.summary: Creates an AIChannel with the specified custom scale to measure strain. This method adds one or more physical channels to the AIChannelCollection.
member.param: The names of one or more physical channels to use to create one or more local virtual channels.
One or more names to assign to the created local virtual channels. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to Empty.
The minimum value expected from the measurement, in units.
The maximum value expected from the measurement, in units.
The bridge configuration of the strain gage.
The source of excitation.
The amount of excitation in volts that the sensor requires.

The sensitivity of the strain gages and relates the change in electrical resistance to the change in strain. Each gage in the bridge must have the same gage factor. Refer to the sensor documentation to determine this value.

The output voltage of the bridge in the unloaded condition. NI-DAQmx subtracts this value from any measurements before applying scaling equations. Perform a voltage measurement on the bridge with no strain applied to determine this value.

The resistance in ohms of the gages in an unstrained position. Each gage in the bridge must have the same nominal gage resistance. The resistance across arms of the bridge that do not have strain gages must also be the same as the nominal gage resistance. Refer to the sensor documentation to determine this value.
The ratio of lateral strain to axial strain in the material you are measuring.
The amount in ohms of resistance in the lead wires. Ideally, this value is the same for all leads.
The name of the custom scale to apply to the local virtual channel.
member.returns: The newly created AIChannel.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.summary: Creates an AIChannel with the specified custom scale to measure voltage for custom sensors that require excitation. This method adds one or more physical channels to the AIChannelCollection.
member.param: The names of one or more physical channels to use to create one or more local virtual channels.
One or more names to assign to the created local virtual channels. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to Empty.
The input terminal configuration. To use the default terminal configuration for the physical channel(s) being used, pass a value of -1 casted to an AITerminalConfiguration.
The minimum value expected from the measurement, in units.
The maximum value expected from the measurement, in units.
The bridge configuration. If you set bridgeConfiguration (parameter) to NoBridge, useExcitationForScaling (parameter) has no effect.
The source of excitation.
The amount of excitation in volts that the sensor requires.

true if NI-DAQmx divides the measurement by the excitation. Typically, you set useExcitationForScaling (parameter) to true for ratiometric tranducers. If you set useExcitationForScaling (parameter) to true, set maximumValue (parameter) and minimumValue (parameter) to reflect the scaling. For example, if you expect to acquire a voltage between -5 and 5, and you use an excitation of .10 volts to scale the measurement, set minimumValue (parameter) to -50 and set maximumValue (parameter) to 50.
The name of the custom scale to apply to the local virtual channel.
member.returns: The newly created AIChannel.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

The channel that acquires the temperature of the thermocouple cold-junction if you set AIThermocoupleCjcSource to Channel. You can use a global channel or another virtual channel already in the task. If the channel is a temperature channel, NI-DAQmx acquires the temperature in the correct units. Other channel types, such as a resistance channel with a custom sensor, must use a custom scale to scale values to degrees Celsius.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIChannelCollection.CreateTedsThermocoupleChannel(System.String,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AITemperatureUnits,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an AIChannel that uses a thermocouple to measure temperature using a measurement on another channel for cold-junction compensation. This method adds one or more physical channels to the AIChannelCollection.
member.param: The names of one or more physical channels to use to create one or more local virtual channels.
One or more names to assign to the created local virtual channels. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to Empty.
The minimum value expected from the measurement, in units (parameter).
The maximum value expected from the measurement, in units (parameter).
The units to use to return the temperature measurement.

The channel that acquires the temperature of the thermocouple cold-junction if you set AIThermocoupleCjcSource to Channel. You can use a global channel or another virtual channel already in the task. If the channel is a temperature channel, NI-DAQmx acquires the temperature in the correct units. Other channel types, such as a resistance channel with a custom sensor, must use a custom scale to scale values to degrees Celsius.
member.returns: The newly created AIChannel.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

The output voltage of the bridge in the unloaded condition. NI-DAQmx subtracts this value from any measurements before applying scaling equations. Perform a voltage measurement on the bridge with no strain applied to determine this value.

The units to use to return the strain measurement.

member.summary: Creates an AIChannel that uses a microphone to measure sound pressure. This method adds one or more physical channels to the AIChannelCollection.
member.param: The names of one or more physical channels to use to create one or more local virtual channels.
One or more names to assign to the created local virtual channels. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to Empty.

member.summary: Creates an AIChannel that uses a Wheatstone bridge to measure force or load, with the specified custom scale. Use this instance with sensors whose specifications do not provide a polynomial for scaling or a table of electrical and physical values. When you use this scaling type, NI-DAQmx uses two points of electrical and physical values to calculate the slope and y-intercept of a linear equation and uses that equation to scale electrical values to physical values. This method adds one or more physical channels to the AIChannelCollection.
member.param: The names of one or more physical channels to use to create one or more local virtual channels.
One or more names to assign to the created local virtual channels. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to Empty.
The minimum value you expect to measure, in custom scaled units.
The maximum value you expect to measure, in custom scaled units.
The name of the custom scale to apply to the local virtual channel.
The type of Wheatstone bridge configuration connected to the channel.
The source of excitation.
The amount of excitation, in volts, that the sensor requires.
The resistance, in ohms, of the bridge while not under load.
The first electrical value, corresponding to firstPhysicalValue (parameter). Specify this value in the units specified with electricalUnits (parameter).
The second electrical value, corresponding to secondPhysicalValue (parameter). Specify this value in the units specified with electricalUnits (parameter).
Specifies from which electrical units to scale data. Use the units that correspond to the units used for electrical values provided by the sensor data sheet or calibration certificate.
The first physical value, corresponding to firstElectricalValue (parameter). Specify this value in the units specified with physicalUnits (parameter).
The second physical value, corresponding to secondElectricalValue (parameter). Specify this value in the units specified with physicalUnits (parameter).
Specifies to which physical units to scale electrical data.
member.returns: The newly created AIChannel.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.summary: Creates an AIChannel that uses a Wheatstone bridge to measure force or load, with the specified custom scale. Use this instance with sensors whose specifications provide a table of electrical values and the corresponding physical values. When you use this scaling type, NI-DAQmx performs linear scaling between each pair of electrical and physical values. The input limits specified with the minimum value and maximum value parameters must fall within the smallest and largest physical values. For any data outside those endpoints, NI-DAQmx coerces that data to the endpoints. This method adds one or more physical channels to the AIChannelCollection.
member.param: The names of one or more physical channels to use to create one or more local virtual channels.
One or more names to assign to the created local virtual channels. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to Empty.
The minimum value you expect to measure, in custom scaled units.
The maximum value you expect to measure, in custom scaled units.
The name of the custom scale to apply to the local virtual channel.
The type of Wheatstone bridge configuration connected to the channel.
The source of excitation.
The amount of excitation, in volts, that the sensor requires.
The resistance, in ohms, of the bridge while not under load.
The array of electrical values that map to the values in physicalValues (parameter). Specify this value in the units specified with electricalUnits (parameter).
Specifies from which electrical units to scale data. Use the units that correspond to the units used for electrical values provided by the sensor data sheet or calibration certificate.
The array of physical values that map to the values in electricalValues (parameter). Specify this value in the units specified with physicalUnits (parameter).
Specifies to which physical units to scale electrical data.
member.returns: The newly created AIChannel.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.summary: Creates an AIChannel that uses a Wheatstone bridge to measure force or load, with the specified custom scale. Use this instance with sensors whose specifications provide a polynomial to convert electrical values to physical values. When you use this scaling type, NI-DAQmx requires coefficients for a polynomial that converts electrical values to physical values (forward), as well as coefficients for a polynomial that converts physical values to electrical values (reverse). If you only know one set of coefficients, use PolynomialScale to generate the other set. This method adds one or more physical channels to the AIChannelCollection.
member.param: The names of one or more physical channels to use to create one or more local virtual channels.
One or more names to assign to the created local virtual channels. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to Empty.
The minimum value you expect to measure, in custom scaled units.
The maximum value you expect to measure, in custom scaled units.
The name of the custom scale to apply to the local virtual channel.
The type of Wheatstone bridge configuration connected to the channel.
The source of excitation.
The amount of excitation, in volts, that the sensor requires.
The resistance, in ohms, of the bridge while not under load.

The array of the forward coefficients of the polynomial. Each element of the array corresponds to a term of the equation. For example, if index three of the array is 9, the fourth term of the equation is 9x^3.

The array of the reverse coefficients of the polynomial. Each element of the array corresponds to a term of the equation. For example, if index three of the array is 9, the fourth term of the equation is 9y^3.
Specifies from which electrical units to scale data. Use the units that correspond to the units used for electrical values provided by the sensor data sheet or calibration certificate.
Specifies to which physical units to scale electrical data.
member.returns: The newly created AIChannel.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.summary: Creates an AIChannel that uses a Wheatstone bridge to measure pressure, with the specified custom scale. Use this instance with sensors whose specifications provide a table of electrical values and the corresponding physical values. When you use this scaling type, NI-DAQmx performs linear scaling between each pair of electrical and physical values. The input limits specified with the minimum value and maximum value parameters must fall within the smallest and largest physical values. For any data outside those endpoints, NI-DAQmx coerces that data to the endpoints. This method adds one or more physical channels to the AIChannelCollection.

member.summary: Creates an AIChannel that uses a Wheatstone bridge to measure pressure, with the specified custom scale. Use this instance with sensors whose specifications provide a polynomial to convert electrical values to physical values. When you use this scaling type, NI-DAQmx requires coefficients for a polynomial that converts electrical values to physical values (forward), as well as coefficients for a polynomial that converts physical values to electrical values (reverse). If you only know one set of coefficients, use PolynomialScale to generate the other set. This method adds one or more physical channels to the AIChannelCollection.
member.param: The names of one or more physical channels to use to create one or more local virtual channels.
One or more names to assign to the created local virtual channels. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to Empty.
The minimum value you expect to measure, in custom scaled units.
The maximum value you expect to measure, in custom scaled units.
The name of the custom scale to apply to the local virtual channel.
The type of Wheatstone bridge configuration connected to the channel.
The source of excitation.
The amount of excitation, in volts, that the sensor requires.
The resistance, in ohms, of the bridge while not under load.

The array of the forward coefficients of the polynomial. Each element of the array corresponds to a term of the equation. For example, if index three of the array is 9, the fourth term of the equation is 9x^3.

The array of the reverse coefficients of the polynomial. Each element of the array corresponds to a term of the equation. For example, if index three of the array is 9, the fourth term of the equation is 9y^3.
Specifies from which electrical units to scale data. Use the units that correspond to the units used for electrical values provided by the sensor data sheet or calibration certificate.
Specifies to which physical units to scale electrical data.
member.returns: The newly created AIChannel.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.summary: Creates an AIChannel that uses a Wheatstone bridge to measure torque, with the specified custom scale. Use this instance with sensors whose specifications do not provide a polynomial for scaling or a table of electrical and physical values. When you use this scaling type, NI-DAQmx uses two points of electrical and physical values to calculate the slope and y-intercept of a linear equation and uses that equation to scale electrical values to physical values. This method adds one or more physical channels to the AIChannelCollection.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIChannelCollection.CreateBridgeChannel(System.String,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.String,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeConfiguration,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIExcitationSource,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates an AIChannel that measures voltage ratios from a Wheatstone bridge, with the specified custom scale. Use this instance with bridge-based sensors that measure phenomena other than strain, force, pressure, or torque, or that scale data to physical units NI-DAQmx does not support. This method adds one or more physical channels to the AIChannelCollection. Use a custom scale or other scaling code to convert the voltage ratios to physical units.
member.param: The names of one or more physical channels to use to create one or more local virtual channels.
One or more names to assign to the created local virtual channels. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to Empty.
The minimum value you expect to measure, in custom scaled units.
The maximum value you expect to measure, in custom scaled units.
The name of the custom scale to apply to the local virtual channel.
The type of Wheatstone bridge configuration connected to the channel.
The source of excitation.
The amount of excitation, in volts, that the sensor requires.
The resistance, in ohms, of the bridge while not under load.
member.returns: The newly created AIChannel.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.summary: Creates a CIChannel with the specified custom scale to measure the frequency of a digital signal. This method adds one channel to the CIChannelCollection.
member.returns: The newly created CIChannel.
member.param: The names of the counters to use to create the virtual channel.
The name to assign to the created channel. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to Empty.
The minimum value expected from the measurement, in units.
The maximum value expected from the measurement, in units.
The edges between which to measure the frequency.
The method to use to calculate the frequency of the signal.

The length of time to measure the frequency of a digital signal when method (parameter) is HighFrequencyTwoCounter. Measurement accuracy increases with increased measurement time and with increased signal frequency. If you measure a high-frequency signal for too long, the count register might roll over, resulting in an incorrect measurement.

The value by which to divide the input signal, when method (parameter) is LargeRangeTwoCounter. The larger the divisor (parameter), the more accurate the measurement. However, too large a value might cause the count register to roll over, resulting in an incorrect measurement.
The name of the custom scale to apply to the local virtual channel.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.summary: Creates a CIChannel that uses an angular encoder to measure angular position. This method adds one channel to the CIChannelCollection.
member.param: The names of the counters to use to create the virtual channels. You can pass a string that contains a list or range of counters to this input.
The name to assign to the created channel. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to Empty.

The count and interpretation of the pulses that the encoder generates on signal A and signal B. X1, X2, and X4 are valid for quadrature encoders only. TwoPulseCounting is valid only for two-pulse encoders.
Whether to use z indexing for the channel.
The value, in units (parameter), to which to reset the measurement when signal Z is high, and signal A and signal B are at the states you specify with zIndexPhase (parameter).

The states that signal A and signal B must be at while signal Z is high for NI-DAQmx to reset the measurement. If the signal Z is never high while the signal A and signal B are high, for example, you must choose a phase other than AHighBHigh.

The number of pulses that the encoder generates per revolution. This value is the number of pulses on one of either the A signal or the B signal, not the total number of pulses on both the A and B signals.
The starting angle of the encoder. This value is in the units that you specify in the units (parameter) parameter.
The units to use to return angular position measurements from the channel.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
member.returns: The newly created CIChannel.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogUnscaledReader.ReadInt16(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads one or more unscaled 16-bit integer samples from one or more AIChannel objects in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set samplesPerChannel (parameter) to -1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set samplesPerChannel (parameter) to -1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the ReadAllAvailableSamples property of the DaqStream you are reading from.
member.returns: A 2D array of unscaled 16-bit integer samples from the task. Each element in the first dimension of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. Each element in the second dimension of the array corresponds to a sample from that channel. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in ChannelsToRead.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.

member.summary: Begins an asynchronous read of one or more unscaled 16-bit integer samples from one or more AIChannel objects in a task.

If you set samplesPerChannel (parameter) to -1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set samplesPerChannel (parameter) to -1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the ReadAllAvailableSamples property of the DaqStream you are reading from.
An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the read is complete. Specify null if you do not want a callback when the read is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous read request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify null if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogUnscaledWriter.Write(System.Boolean,System.UInt16[0:,0:])
member.summary: Writes one or more unscaled 16-bit unsigned integer samples to one or more AOChannel objects in a task.
member.param: If set to true this method automatically calls Start if you do not explicitly call it.

A 2D array of samples to write to the task. Each element in the first dimension of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. Each element in the second dimension of the array corresponds to a sample to write to each channel. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task. The order of the lines in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the lines to the channel.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
data (parameter) has a non-zero lower bound.
