member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogUnscaledWriter.BeginWrite(System.Boolean,System.UInt16[0:,0:],System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous write of one or more unscaled 16-bit unsigned integer samples to one or more AOChannel objects in a task.
member.param: If set to true this method automatically calls Start if you do not explicitly call it.

A 2D array of samples to write to the task. Each element in the first dimension of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. Each element in the second dimension of the array corresponds to a sample to write to each channel. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task. The order of the lines in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the lines to the channel.
An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the write is complete. Specify null if you do not want a callback when the write is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous write request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify null if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.
member.returns: An IAsyncResult that represents the asynchronous call.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ScaleType
member.summary: Specifies the type of custom scale.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ScaleType.Table
member.summary: An array of raw values is mapped to an array of corresponding scaled values, with all other values scaled proportionally.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ScaleType.RangeMap
member.summary: Values are scaled proportionally from a range of raw values to a range of scaled values.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ScaleType.Polynomial
member.summary: Values are scaled by using an nth order polynomial equation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ScaleType.Linear
member.summary: Values are scaled linearly.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal
member.summary: Specifies the name of the trigger, clock, or event to export.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.CounterOutputEvent
member.summary: Signal a counter generates. Each time the counter reaches terminal count, this signal toggles or pulses.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.AIHoldCompleteEvent
member.summary: Signal an E Series device generates when the device latches analog input data (the ADC enters "hold" mode) and it is safe for any external switching hardware to remove the signal and replace it with the next signal. This event does not indicate the completion of the actual analog-to-digital conversion.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.AdvanceCompleteEvent
member.summary: Signal a switch product generates after it both executes the command(s) in a scan list entry and waits for the settling time to elapse.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.Timebase20MHz
member.summary: Output of an oscillator that is the onboard source of the Master Timebase. Other timebases are derived from this clock.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.AIConvertClock
member.summary: Clock that causes an analog-to-digital conversion on an E Series device. One conversion corresponds to a single sample from one channel.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.ReferenceTrigger
member.summary: Trigger that establishes the reference point between pretrigger and posttrigger samples.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.AdvanceTrigger
member.summary: Trigger that moves a switch to the next entry in a scan list.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.SampleClock
member.summary: Clock the device uses to time each sample.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.StartTrigger
member.summary: Trigger that begins a measurement or generation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.WatchdogExpiredEvent
member.summary: The signal that a static DIO device generates when the watchdog timer expires.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.ChangeDetectionEvent
member.summary: The signal that a static DIO device generates when the device detects a rising or falling edge on any of the lines or ports you selected when you configured change detection timing.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.ReferenceClock10MHz
member.summary: Output of an oscillator that you can use to synchronize multiple devices.

member.param: If set to true this method automatically calls Start if you do not explicitly call it. You cannot set this parameter to true if you have installed events on the task.

A 1D array of samples to write to the task. Each element of the array corresponds to a sample to write to the channel. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task.
An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the write is complete. Specify null if you do not want a callback when the write is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous write request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify null if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.
member.returns: An IAsyncResult that represents the asynchronous call.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterMultiChannelWriter.EndWrite(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Handles the end of an asynchronous write initiated with any of the counter asynchronous write methods, such as BeginWriteSingleSample.
member.param: An IAsyncResult that represents an asynchronous call started by calling any of the counter asynchronous write methods, such as BeginWriteSingleSample.
member.exception: asyncResult (parameter) is null or is not an instance of IAsyncResult returned from a call to one of the counter asynchronous write methods, such as BeginWriteSingleSample.
The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error during the asynchronous operation.
The data provided to one of the counter asynchronous write methods, such as BeginWriteSingleSample, had a non-zero lower bound.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.BasicTedsDataOption.WriteToEeprom
member.summary: Basic TEDS data is written to the EEPROM, even if the sensor includes a PROM. You cannot write basic TEDS data if the PROM contains data.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqBuffer.InputBufferSize
member.summary: Specifies the number of samples the input buffer can hold for each channel in the task. Zero indicates to allocate no buffer. Use a buffer size of 0 to perform a hardware-timed operation without using a buffer. Setting this property overrides the automatic input buffer allocation that NI-DAQmx performs.

member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqBuffer.OutputBufferSize
member.summary: Specifies the number of samples the output buffer can hold for each channel in the task. Zero indicates to allocate no buffer. Use a buffer size of 0 to perform a hardware-timed operation without using a buffer. Setting this property overrides the automatic output buffer allocation that NI-DAQmx performs.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.summary: Specifies in samples per channel the size of the onboard output buffer of the device.

member.returns: A string representation of the object.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SinglePoint.WaitForNextSampleClock(System.Double)
member.summary: Waits until the next pulse of the sample clock occurs.
member.param: The maximum amount of time, in seconds, to wait for the next sample clock pulse. If the time elapses, this method returns an error. If you set timeout to -1, this method waits indefinitely.
member.returns: Specifies whether the next sample clock is late.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SinglePoint.WaitForNextSampleClock
member.summary: Waits until the next pulse of the sample clock occurs, with a timeout value of 10 seconds.
member.returns: Specifies whether the next sample clock is late.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SinglePoint.ConvertLateErrorsToWarnings
member.summary: Specifies if WaitForNextSampleClock and reading from the task convert late errors to warnings. NI-DAQmx returns no late warnings or errors until the number of warmup iterations you specify with NumberOfWarmupIterations execute.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SinglePoint.NumberOfWarmupIterations
member.summary: Specifies the number of loop iterations that must occur before WaitForNextSampleClock and reading from the task return any late warnings or errors. The system needs a number of iterations to stabilize. During this period, a large amount of jitter occurs, potentially causing reads and writes to be late. The default number of warmup iterations is 100. Specify a larger number if needed to stabilize the system.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SinglePoint.WaitForNextSampleClockWaitMode
member.summary: Specifies how WaitForNextSampleClock waits for the next Sample Clock pulse.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SinglePoint.ReportMissedSamples
member.summary: Specifies whether reading from the task returns lateness errors or warnings when it detects missed Sample Clock pulses. This setting does not affect WaitForNextSampleClock. Set this property to true for applications that need to detect lateness without using WaitForNextSampleClock.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SinglePoint.WriteRecoveryMode
member.summary: Specifies how NI-DAQmx attempts to recover after missing a Sample Clock pulse when performing counter writes.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleClockTimingResponseMode
member.summary: Specifies how the device responds to the sample clock and to triggers.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleClockTimingResponseMode.SingleCycle
member.summary: Device responds by the next sample clock edge.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleClockTimingResponseMode.Multicycle
member.summary: Device acquires or generates samples on the next sample clock edge, but does not respond to certain triggers until a few sample clock edges later. Refer to device documentation for information about which triggers the multicycle response mode affects. This response mode allows higher data transfer rates at the cost of increased latency for responding to triggers.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeScaleType
member.summary: Specifies the scaling type to use when scaling electrical values from the sensor to physical units.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeScaleType.None
member.summary: Do not scale electrical values to physical units.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeScaleType.TwoPointLinear
member.summary: You provide two pairs of electrical values and their corresponding physical values. NI-DAQmx uses those values to calculate the slope and y-intercept of a linear equation and uses that equation to scale electrical values to physical values.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeScaleType.Table
member.summary: Map an array of electrical values to an array of corresponding physical values, with all other values scaled proportionally. If you specify this scaling type, Maximum and Minimum must be within the smallest and largest physical values. For any data outside those endpoints, NI-DAQmx coerces that data to the endpoints.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeScaleType.Polynomial
member.summary: Scale values by using an Nth order polynomial equation.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AICoupling
member.summary: Specifies the coupling for the channel.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AICoupling.AC
member.summary: Remove the DC offset from the signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AICoupling.DC
member.summary: Allow NI-DAQmx to measure all of the signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AICoupling.Ground
member.summary: Remove the signal from the measurement and measure only ground.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIResistanceConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies the resistance configuration for the channel. NI-DAQmx uses this value for any resistance-based measurements, including temperature measurement using a thermistor or RTD.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIResistanceConfiguration.TwoWire
member.summary: 2-wire mode.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIResistanceConfiguration.ThreeWire
member.summary: 3-wire mode.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIResistanceConfiguration.FourWire
member.summary: 4-wire mode.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies the type of Wheatstone bridge connected to the channel.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeConfiguration.FullBridge
member.summary: Sensor is a full bridge. If you set UseExcitationForScaling to true, NI-DAQmx divides the measurement by the excitation value. Many sensors scale data to native units using scaling of volts per excitation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeConfiguration.HalfBridge
member.summary: Sensor is a half bridge. If you set UseExcitationForScaling to true, NI-DAQmx divides the measurement by the excitation value. Many sensors scale data to native units using scaling of volts per excitation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeConfiguration.QuarterBridge
member.summary: Sensor is a quarter bridge. If you set UseExcitationForScaling to true, NI-DAQmx divides the measurement by the excitation value. Many sensors scale data to native units using scaling of volts per excitation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeConfiguration.NoBridge
member.summary: Sensor is not a Wheatstone bridge.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeShuntCalibrationSelect
member.summary: Specifies which shunt calibration switch(es) to enable. Use BridgeShuntCalibrationEnable to enable the switch(es) you specify with this property.

member.summary: Switch A.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeShuntCalibrationSelect.B
member.summary: Switch B.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeShuntCalibrationSelect.AAndB

member.summary: Specifies the shunt resistor location for current measurements.

member.summary: Use the built-in shunt resistor of the device.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AICurrentShuntLocation.External
member.summary: Use a shunt resistor external to the device. You must specify the value of the shunt resistor by using CurrentShuntResistance.

member.summary: Specifies the source of excitation.

member.summary: Use the built-in excitation source of the device. If you select this value, you must specify the amount of excitation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIExcitationSource.External
member.summary: Use an excitation source other than the built-in excitation source of the device. If you select this value, you must specify the amount of excitation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIExcitationSource.None
member.summary: Supply no excitation to the channel.

member.summary: 4-wire.

member.summary: Indicates the units of Resolution.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIResolutionUnits.Bits
member.summary: Bits.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIRawSampleJustification
member.summary: Indicates the justification of a raw sample from the device.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIRawSampleJustification.RightJustified
member.summary: Samples occupy the lower bits of the integer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIRawSampleJustification.LeftJustified
member.summary: Samples occupy the higher bits of the integer.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIAdcTimingMode
member.summary: Specifies the ADC timing mode, controlling the tradeoff between speed and effective resolution. Some ADC timing modes provide increased powerline noise rejection. On devices that have an AI Convert clock, this setting affects both the maximum and default values for AIConvertRate. You must use the same ADC timing mode for all channels on a device, but you can use different ADC timing modes for different devices in the same task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIAdcTimingMode.HighResolution
member.summary: Increases resolution and noise rejection while decreasing conversion rate.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIAdcTimingMode.HighSpeed
member.summary: Increases conversion rate while decreasing resolution.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIAdcTimingMode.Best50HzRejection
member.summary: Improves 50 Hz noise rejection while decreasing noise rejection at other frequencies.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIAdcTimingMode.Best60HzRejection
member.summary: Improves 60 Hz noise rejection while decreasing noise rejection at other frequencies.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIAdcTimingMode.Custom
member.summary: Use AdcCustomTimingMode to specify a custom value controlling the tradeoff between speed and resolution.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIChannelCalibrationScaleType
member.summary: Specifies the method or equation form that the calibration scale uses.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIChannelCalibrationScaleType.Polynomial
member.summary: Scale values by using an Nth order polynomial equation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIChannelCalibrationScaleType.Table
member.summary: Map an array of prescaled values to an array of corresponding scaled values, with all other values scaled proportionally.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIAutoZeroMode
member.summary: Specifies how often to measure ground. NI-DAQmx subtracts the measured ground voltage from every sample.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIAutoZeroMode.None
member.summary: Do not perform an autozero.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIAutoZeroMode.Once
member.summary: Perform an auto zero at the beginning of the acquisition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIAutoZeroMode.EverySample
member.summary: Perform an auto zero at every sample of the acquisition.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIDataTransferMechanism
member.summary: Specifies the data transfer mode for the device.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIDataTransferMechanism.Dma
member.summary: Direct Memory Access. Data transfers take place independently from the application.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIDataTransferMechanism.Interrupts
member.summary: Data transfers take place independently from the application. Using interrupts increases CPU usage because the CPU must service interrupt requests. Typically, you should use interrupts if the device is out of DMA channels.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIDataTransferMechanism.ProgrammedIO
member.summary: Data transfers take place when you call reading from the task or writing to the task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIDataTransferMechanism.UsbBulk
member.summary: Data transfers take place independently from the application using a USB bulk pipe.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIDataTransferRequestCondition
member.summary: Specifies under what condition to transfer data from the onboard memory of the device to the buffer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIDataTransferRequestCondition.OnBoardMemoryMoreThanHalfFull
member.summary: Transfer data from the device when more than half of the onboard memory of the device fills.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIDataTransferRequestCondition.OnBoardMemoryNotEmpty
member.summary: Transfer data from the device when there is data in the onboard memory.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIDataTransferRequestCondition.OnBoardMemoryCustomThreshold
member.summary: Transfer data from the device when the number of samples specified with DataTransferCustomThreshold are in the device FIFO.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIDataTransferRequestCondition.WhenAcquisitionComplete
member.summary: Transfer data when the acquisition is complete.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIRawDataCompressionType
member.summary: Specifies the type of compression to apply to raw samples returned from the device.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIRawDataCompressionType.None
member.summary: Do not compress samples.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIRawDataCompressionType.LosslessPacking
member.summary: Remove unused bits from samples. No resolution is lost.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIRawDataCompressionType.LossyLsbRemoval
member.summary: Remove unused bits from samples. Then, if necessary, remove bits from samples until the samples are the size specified with LossyLsbRemovalCompressedSampleSize. This compression type limits resolution to the specified sample size.

member.summary: Direct Memory Access. Data transfers take place independently from the application.

member.summary: Specifies under what condition to transfer data from the buffer to the onboard memory of the device.

member.summary: Transfer data to the device only when there is no data in the onboard memory of the device.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DILogicFamily
member.summary: Specifies the logic family to use for acquisition. A logic family corresponds to voltage thresholds that are compatible with a group of voltage standards. Refer to the device documentation for information on the logic high and logic low voltages for these logic families.

member.summary: Compatible with 2.5 V CMOS signals.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DILogicFamily.ThreePointThreeVolts
member.summary: Compatible with LVTTL signals.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DILogicFamily.FiveVolts
member.summary: Compatible with TTL and 5 V CMOS signals.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DOOutputDriveType
member.summary: Specifies the drive type for digital output channels.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DOOutputDriveType.ActiveDrive
member.summary: Drive the output pin to approximately 0 V for logic low and +3.3 V or +5 V, depending on the device, for logic high.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DOOutputDriveType.OpenCollector
member.summary: Drive the output pin to 0 V for logic low. For logic high, the output driver assumes a high-impedance state and does not drive a voltage.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DOLineStatesStartState
member.summary: Specifies the state of the lines in a digital output task when the task starts.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DOLineStatesStartState.High
member.summary: Logic high.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DOLineStatesStartState.Low
member.summary: Logic low.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DOLineStatesStartState.Tristate
member.summary: High-impedance state. You can select this state only on devices with bidirectional lines. You cannot select this state for dedicated digital output lines. On some devices, you can select this value only for entire ports.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DOLineStatesStartState.NoChange
member.summary: Do not change the state of the lines. On some devices, you can select this value only for entire ports.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIEncoderDecodingType
member.summary: Specifies how to count and interpret the pulses the encoder generates on signal A and signal B. X1, X2, and X4 are valid for quadrature encoders only. TwoPulseCounting is valid for two-pulse encoders only.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIEncoderDecodingType.X1
member.summary: If signal A leads signal B, count the rising edges of signal A. If signal B leads signal A, count the falling edges of signal A.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIEncoderDecodingType.X2
member.summary: Count the rising and falling edges of signal A.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIEncoderDecodingType.X4
member.summary: Count the rising and falling edges of signal A and signal B.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIEncoderDecodingType.TwoPulseCounting
member.summary: Increment the count on rising edges of signal A. Decrement the count on rising edges of signal B.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIEncoderZIndexPhase
member.summary: Specifies the states at which signal A and signal B must be while signal Z is high for NI-DAQmx to reset the measurement. If signal Z is never high while signal A and signal B are high, for example, you must choose a phase other than AHighBHigh.

member.summary: Reset the measurement when signal A and signal B are high.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIEncoderZIndexPhase.AHighBLow
member.summary: Reset the measurement when signal A is high and signal B is low.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIEncoderZIndexPhase.ALowBHigh
member.summary: Reset the measurement when signal A is low and signal B high.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIEncoderZIndexPhase.ALowBLow
member.summary: Reset the measurement when signal A and signal B are low.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIGpsSyncMethod
member.summary: Specifies the method to use to synchronize the counter to a GPS receiver.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIGpsSyncMethod.IrigB
member.summary: Use the IRIG-B synchronization method. The GPS receiver sends one synchronization pulse per second, as well as information about the number of days, hours, minutes, and seconds that elapsed since the beginning of the current year.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIGpsSyncMethod.Pps
member.summary: Use the PPS synchronization method. The GPS receiver sends one synchronization pulse per second, but does not send any timing information. The timestamp measurement returns the number of seconds that elapsed since the device powered up unless you set TimestampInitialSeconds.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIGpsSyncMethod.None
member.summary: Do not synchronize the counter to a GPS receiver. The timestamp measurement returns the number of seconds that elapsed since the device powered up unless you set TimestampInitialSeconds.

member.summary: Direct Memory Access. Data transfers take place independently from the application.

member.summary: Data transfers take place independently from the application. Using interrupts increases CPU usage because the CPU must service interrupt requests. Typically, you should use interrupts if the device is out of DMA channels.

member.summary: Data transfers take place when you call reading from the task or writing to the task.

member.summary: Data transfers take place independently from the application using a USB bulk pipe.

member.summary: Transfer data from the device when more than half of the onboard memory of the device fills.

member.summary: Transfer data from the device when there is data in the onboard memory.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIDataTransferRequestCondition.WhenAcquisitionComplete

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.COConstrainedGenerationMode
member.summary: Specifies constraints to apply when the counter generates pulses. Constraining the counter reduces the device resources required for counter operation. Constraining the counter can also allow additional analog or counter tasks on the device to run concurrently. For continuous counter tasks, NI-DAQmx consumes no device resources when the counter is constrained. For finite counter tasks, resource use increases with the frequency regardless of the constraint mode. However, fixed frequency constraints significantly reduce resource usage, and fixed duty cycle constraint marginally reduces it.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.COConstrainedGenerationMode.Unconstrained
member.summary: Counter has no restrictions on pulse generation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.COConstrainedGenerationMode.FixedHighFrequency
member.summary: Pulse frequency must be above 7.63 Hz and cannot change while the task runs. In this mode, the duty cycle has 8 bits of resolution.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.COConstrainedGenerationMode.FixedLowFrequency
member.summary: Pulse frequency must be below 366.21 Hz and cannot change while the task runs. In this mode, the duty cycle has 16 bits of resolution.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.COConstrainedGenerationMode.Fixed50PercentDutyCycle
member.summary: Pulse duty cycle must be 50 percent. The frequency can change while the task runs.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CODataTransferMechanism
member.summary: Specifies the data transfer mode for the device. For buffered operations, use DMA or USB Bulk. For non-buffered operations, use Polled.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CODataTransferMechanism.Dma
member.summary: Direct Memory Access. Data transfers take place independently from the application.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CODataTransferMechanism.Interrupts
member.summary: Data transfers take place independently from the application. Using interrupts increases CPU usage because the CPU must service interrupt requests. Typically, you should use interrupts if the device is out of DMA channels.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CODataTransferMechanism.ProgrammedIO
member.summary: Data transfers take place when you call reading from the task or writing to the task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CODataTransferMechanism.UsbBulk
member.summary: Data transfers take place independently from the application using a USB bulk pipe.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CODataTransferRequestCondition.OnBoardMemoryEmpty
member.summary: Transfer data to the device only when there is no data in the onboard memory of the device.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CODataTransferRequestCondition.OnBoardMemoryHalfFullOrLess
member.summary: Transfer data to the device any time the onboard memory is less than half full.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadRelativeTo
member.summary: Specifies the point in the buffer at which to begin a read operation. If you also specify an offset with ReadOffset, the read operation begins at that offset relative to the point you select with this property. The default value is CurrentReadPosition unless you configure a Reference Trigger for the task. If you configure a Reference Trigger, the default value is FirstPretriggerSample.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadRelativeTo.FirstSample
member.summary: Start reading samples relative to the first sample acquired.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadRelativeTo.CurrentReadPosition
member.summary: Start reading samples relative to the last sample returned by the previous read. For the first read operation, this position is the first sample acquired or the first pretrigger sample if you configured a reference trigger for the task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadRelativeTo.ReferenceTrigger
member.summary: Start reading samples relative to the first sample after the reference trigger occurred.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadRelativeTo.FirstPretriggerSample
member.summary: Start reading samples relative to the first pretrigger sample. You specify the number of pretrigger samples to acquire when you configure a reference trigger.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadRelativeTo.MostRecentSample
member.summary: Start reading samples relative to the next sample acquired. For example, use this value and set ReadOffset to -1 to read the last sample acquired.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadOverwriteMode
member.summary: Specifies whether to overwrite samples in the buffer that you have not yet read.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadOverwriteMode.OverwriteUnreadSamples
member.summary: When an acquisition encounters unread data in the buffer, the acquisition continues and overwrites the unread samples with new ones. You can read the new samples by setting ReadRelativeTo to MostRecentSample and setting ReadOffset to the appropriate number of samples.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadOverwriteMode.DoNotOverwriteUnreadSamples
member.summary: The acquisition stops when it encounters a sample in the buffer that you have not read.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.LoggingMode
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable logging and whether to allow reading data while logging. Log mode allows for the best performance. However, you cannot read data while logging if you specify this mode. If you want to read data while logging, specify Log and Read mode.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.LoggingMode.Off
member.summary: Disable logging for the task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.LoggingMode.Log
member.summary: Enable logging for the task. You cannot read data using reading from the task when using this mode. If you require access to the data, read from the TDMS file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.LoggingMode.LogAndRead
member.summary: Enable both logging and reading data for the task. You must use reading from the task to read samples for NI-DAQmx to stream them to disk.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TdmsLoggingOperation
member.summary: Specifies how to open the TDMS file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TdmsLoggingOperation.Open
member.summary: Open an existing TDMS file, and append data to that file. If the file does not exist, NI-DAQmx returns an error.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TdmsLoggingOperation.OpenOrCreate
member.summary: Open an existing TDMS file, and append data to that file. If the file does not exist, NI-DAQmx creates a new TDMS file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TdmsLoggingOperation.CreateOrReplace
member.summary: Create a new TDMS file, or replace an existing TDMS file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TdmsLoggingOperation.Create
member.summary: Create a new TDMS file. If the file already exists, NI-DAQmx returns an error.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadWaitMode
member.summary: Specifies how reading from the task waits for samples to become available.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadWaitMode.WaitForInterrupt
member.summary: Check for available samples when the system receives an interrupt service request. This mode is the most CPU efficient, but results in lower possible sampling rates.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadWaitMode.Poll
member.summary: Repeatedly check for available samples as fast as possible. This mode allows for the highest sampling rates at the expense of CPU efficiency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadWaitMode.Yield
member.summary: Repeatedly check for available samples, but yield control to other threads after each check. This mode offers a balance between sampling rate and CPU efficiency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadWaitMode.Sleep
member.summary: Check for available samples once per the amount of time specified in ReadSleepTime.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteRelativeTo
member.summary: Specifies the point in the buffer at which to write data. If you also specify an offset with WriteOffset, the write operation begins at that offset relative to this point you select with this property.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteRelativeTo.FirstSample
member.summary: Write samples relative to the first sample.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteRelativeTo.CurrentWritePosition
member.summary: Write samples relative to the current position in the buffer.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteRegenerationMode
member.summary: Specifies whether to allow NI-DAQmx to generate the same data multiple times.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteRegenerationMode.AllowRegeneration
member.summary: Allow NI-DAQmx to regenerate samples that the device previously generated. When you choose this value, the write marker returns to the beginning of the buffer after the device generates all samples currently in the buffer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteRegenerationMode.DoNotAllowRegeneration
member.summary: Do not allow NI-DAQmx to regenerate samples the device previously generated. When you choose this value, NI-DAQmx waits for you to write more samples to the buffer or until the timeout expires.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteWaitMode
member.summary: Specifies how writing to the task waits for space to become available in the buffer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteWaitMode.Poll
member.summary: Repeatedly check for available buffer space as fast as possible. This mode allows for the highest sampling rates at the expense of CPU efficiency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteWaitMode.Yield
member.summary: Repeatedly check for available buffer space, but yield control to other threads after each check. This mode offers a balance between sampling rate and CPU efficiency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteWaitMode.Sleep
member.summary: Check for available buffer space once per the amount of time specified in WriteSleepTime.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleQuantityMode
member.summary: Specifies if a task acquires or generates a finite number of samples or if it continuously acquires or generates samples.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleQuantityMode.FiniteSamples
member.summary: Acquire or generate a finite number of samples.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleQuantityMode.ContinuousSamples
member.summary: Acquire or generate samples until you stop the task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleQuantityMode.HardwareTimedSinglePoint
member.summary: Acquire or generate samples continuously using hardware timing without a buffer. Hardware timed single point sample mode is supported only for the sample clock and change detection timing types.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleTimingType
member.summary: Specifies the type of sample timing to use for the task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleTimingType.SampleClock
member.summary: Acquire or generate samples on the specified edge of the sample clock.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleTimingType.BurstHandshake
member.summary: Determine sample timing using burst handshaking between the device and a peripheral device.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleTimingType.Handshake
member.summary: Determine sample timing by using digital handshaking between the device and a peripheral device.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleTimingType.Implicit
member.summary: Configure only the duration of the task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleTimingType.OnDemand
member.summary: Acquire or generate a sample on each read or write operation. This timing type is also referred to as static or software-timed.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleTimingType.ChangeDetection
member.summary: Acquire samples when a change occurs in the state of one or more digital input lines. The lines must be contained within a digital input channel.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleTimingType.PipelinedSampleClock
member.summary: Device acquires or generates samples on each sample clock edge, but does not respond to certain triggers until a few sample clock edges later. Pipelining allows higher data transfer rates at the cost of increased trigger response latency. Refer to the device documentation for information about which triggers pipelining affects. This timing type allows handshaking with some devices using the Pause trigger, the Ready for Transfer event, or the Data Active event. Refer to the device documentation for more information.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleClockActiveEdge
member.summary: Specifies on which edge of a clock pulse sampling takes place. This property is useful primarily when the signal you use as the Sample Clock is not a periodic clock.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleClockActiveEdge.Rising
member.summary: Rising edge(s).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleClockActiveEdge.Falling
member.summary: Falling edge(s).

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleClockOverrunBehavior
member.summary: Specifies the action to take if Sample Clock edges occur faster than the device can handle them.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleClockOverrunBehavior.StopTaskAndError
member.summary: Stop task and return an error.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleClockOverrunBehavior.IgnoreOverruns
member.summary: NI-DAQmx ignores Sample Clock overruns, and the task continues to run.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleClockUnderflowBehavior
member.summary: Specifies the action to take when the onboard memory of the device becomes empty.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleClockUnderflowBehavior.HaltOutputAndError
member.summary: Stop generating samples and return an error.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleClockUnderflowBehavior.PauseUntilDataAvailable
member.summary: Pause the task until samples are available in the FIFO.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleClockTimebaseActiveEdge
member.summary: Specifies on which edge to recognize a Sample Clock Timebase pulse. This property is useful primarily when the signal you use as the Sample Clock Timebase is not a periodic clock.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleClockTimebaseActiveEdge.Rising
member.summary: Rising edge(s).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleClockTimebaseActiveEdge.Falling
member.summary: Falling edge(s).

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.HandshakeStartCondition
member.summary: Specifies the point in the handshake cycle that the device is in when the task starts.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.HandshakeStartCondition.Immediate
member.summary: Device is waiting for space in the FIFO (for acquisition) or waiting for samples (for generation).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.HandshakeStartCondition.WaitForHandshakeTriggerAssert
member.summary: Device is waiting for the Handshake Trigger to assert.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.HandshakeStartCondition.WaitForHandshakeTriggerDeassert
member.summary: Device is waiting for the Handshake Trigger to deassert.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.HandshakeSampleInputDataCondition
member.summary: Specifies on which edge of the Handshake Trigger an input task latches the data from the peripheral device.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.HandshakeSampleInputDataCondition.HandshakeTriggerAsserts
member.summary: Latch data when the Handshake Trigger asserts.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.HandshakeSampleInputDataCondition.HandshakeTriggerDeasserts
member.summary: Latch data when the Handshake Trigger deasserts.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ImplicitUnderflowBehavior
member.summary: Specifies the action to take when the onboard memory of the device becomes empty.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ImplicitUnderflowBehavior.HaltOutputAndError
member.summary: Stop generating samples and return an error.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ImplicitUnderflowBehavior.PauseUntilDataAvailable
member.summary: Pause the task until samples are available in the FIFO.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIConvertActiveEdge
member.summary: Specifies on which edge of the clock pulse an analog-to-digital conversion takes place.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIConvertActiveEdge.Rising
member.summary: Rising edge(s).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIConvertActiveEdge.Falling
member.summary: Falling edge(s).

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIConvertTimebaseSource
member.summary: Specifies the terminal of the signal to use as the AI Convert Clock Timebase.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIConvertTimebaseSource.SameAsSampleTimebase
member.summary: Use the same source as Sample Clock timebase.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIConvertTimebaseSource.Timebase100MHz
member.summary: Use the onboard 100MHz timebase.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIConvertTimebaseSource.SameAsMasterTimebase
member.summary: Use the same source as the Master Timebase.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIConvertTimebaseSource.Timebase20MHz
member.summary: Use the onboard 20MHz timebase.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIConvertTimebaseSource.Timebase80MHz
member.summary: Use the onboard 80MHz timebase.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DelayFromSampleClockUnits
member.summary: Specifies the units of DelayFromSampleClock.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DelayFromSampleClockUnits.Seconds
member.summary: Seconds.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DelayFromSampleClockUnits.Ticks
member.summary: Timebase ticks.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WaitForNextSampleClockWaitMode
member.summary: Specifies how WaitForNextSampleClock waits for the next Sample Clock pulse.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WaitForNextSampleClockWaitMode.WaitForInterrupt
member.summary: Check for Sample Clock pulses when the system receives an interrupt service request. This mode is the most CPU efficient, but results in lower possible sampling rates.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WaitForNextSampleClockWaitMode.Poll
member.summary: Repeatedly check for Sample Clock pulses as fast as possible. This mode allows for the highest sampling rates at the expense of CPU efficiency.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteRecoveryMode
member.summary: Specifies how NI-DAQmx attempts to recover after missing a Sample Clock pulse when performing counter writes.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteRecoveryMode.WaitForInterrupt
member.summary: Attempt to recover when the system receives an interrupt service request. This mode is the most CPU efficient and best suited for recovery at lower pulse train frequencies.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteRecoveryMode.Poll
member.summary: Repeatedly attempt to recover as fast as possible. This mode has the highest probability of recovery success at the expense of CPU efficiency.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SwitchChannelUsage
member.summary: Specifies how you can use the channel. Using this property acts as a safety mechanism to prevent you from connecting two source channels, for example.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SwitchChannelUsage.Source
member.summary: You can use the channel only as an input for a signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SwitchChannelUsage.Load
member.summary: You can use the channel only as the output for a signal passing through the switch.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SwitchChannelUsage.ReservedForRouting
member.summary: You can use the channel only to complete routes within a switch.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SwitchScanBreakMode
member.summary: Specifies the action to take between each entry in a scan list.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SwitchScanBreakMode.NoAction
member.summary: When advancing to the next entry in the scan list, leave all previous connections intact.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SwitchScanBreakMode.BreakBeforeMake
member.summary: When advancing to the next entry in the scan list, disconnect all previous connections before making any new connections.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SwitchScanRepeatMode
member.summary: Specifies if the task advances through the scan list multiple times.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SwitchScanRepeatMode.Finite
member.summary: The task advances through the scan list one time only. NI-DAQmx ignores any Advance Triggers after completing the scan list.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SwitchScanRepeatMode.Continuous
member.summary: The task returns to the beginning of the scan list when it reaches the end of the scan list.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.StartTriggerType
member.summary: Specifies the type of trigger to use to start a task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.StartTriggerType.AnalogEdge
member.summary: Trigger when an analog signal signal crosses a threshold.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.StartTriggerType.DigitalEdge
member.summary: Trigger on the rising or falling edge of a digital signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.StartTriggerType.DigitalPattern
member.summary: Trigger when digital physical channels match a digital pattern.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.StartTriggerType.AnalogWindow
member.summary: Trigger when an analog signal enters or leaves a range of values. The range is in the units of the measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.StartTriggerType.None
member.summary: Disable triggering for the task.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.StartTriggerDelayUnits
member.summary: Specifies the units of Delay.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.StartTriggerDelayUnits.SampleClockPeriods
member.summary: Complete periods of the Sample Clock.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.StartTriggerDelayUnits.Seconds
member.summary: Seconds.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.StartTriggerDelayUnits.Ticks
member.summary: Timebase ticks.

member.summary: Rising edge(s).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalEdgeStartTriggerEdge.Falling
member.summary: Falling edge(s).

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalPatternStartTriggerCondition
member.summary: Specifies whether the Start Trigger occurs when the physical channels specified with Source match or differ from the digital pattern specified with Pattern.

member.summary: Trigger when the physical channels match the specified pattern.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalPatternStartTriggerCondition.PatternDoesNotMatch
member.summary: Trigger when the physical channels do not match the specified pattern.

member.summary: Specifies on which slope of the trigger signal to start acquiring or generating samples.

member.summary: Trigger on the rising slope of the signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogEdgeStartTriggerSlope.Falling
member.summary: Trigger on the falling slope of the signal.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogEdgeStartTriggerCoupling
member.summary: Specifies the coupling for the source signal of the trigger if the source is a terminal rather than a virtual channel.

member.summary: Alternating Current.

member.summary: Direct Current.

member.summary: Trigger when the signal enters the window.

member.summary: Trigger when the signal leaves the window.

member.summary: Specifies the coupling for the source signal of the trigger if the source is a terminal rather than a virtual channel.

member.summary: Alternating Current.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogWindowStartTriggerCoupling.DC

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AdvanceTriggerType
member.summary: Specifies the type of trigger to use to advance to the next entry in a switch scan list.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AdvanceTriggerType.DigitalEdge
member.summary: Advance to the next entry in a scan list on the rising or falling edge of a digital signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AdvanceTriggerType.Software
member.summary: Advance to the next entry in a scan list when you call sending a software trigger.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AdvanceTriggerType.None
member.summary: Advance through all entries in the scan list as fast as possible.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalEdgeAdvanceTriggerEdge
member.summary: Specifies on which edge of a digital signal to advance to the next entry in a scan list.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalEdgeAdvanceTriggerEdge.Rising
member.summary: Rising edge(s).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalEdgeAdvanceTriggerEdge.Falling
member.summary: Falling edge(s).

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.HandshakeTriggerType
member.summary: Specifies the type of Handshake Trigger to use.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.HandshakeTriggerType.Interlocked
member.summary: Use the Handshake Trigger as a control signal for asynchronous handshaking, such as 8255 handshaking.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.HandshakeTriggerType.None
member.summary: Start the measurement or generation immediately when you start the task.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.InterlockedHandshakeTriggerAssertedLevel
member.summary: Specifies the asserted level of the Handshake Trigger.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.InterlockedHandshakeTriggerAssertedLevel.High
member.summary: High state.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.InterlockedHandshakeTriggerAssertedLevel.Low
member.summary: Low state.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.PauseTriggerType
member.summary: Specifies the type of trigger to use to pause a task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.PauseTriggerType.AnalogLevel
member.summary: Pause the measurement or generation while an analog signal is above or below a level.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.PauseTriggerType.AnalogWindow
member.summary: Pause the measurement or generation while an analog signal is either inside or outside of a range of values.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.PauseTriggerType.DigitalLevel
member.summary: Pause the measurement or generation while a digital signal is at either a high or low state.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.PauseTriggerType.DigitalPattern
member.summary: Pause the measurement or generation while digital physical channels either match or do not match a digital pattern.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.PauseTriggerType.None
member.summary: Do not pause the measurement or generation.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogLevelPauseTriggerCondition
member.summary: Specifies whether the task pauses above or below the threshold you specify with Level.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogLevelPauseTriggerCondition.AboveLevel
member.summary: Pause the measurement or generation while the signal is above the threshold.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogLevelPauseTriggerCondition.BelowLevel
member.summary: Pause the measurement or generation while the signal is below the threshold.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogEdgePauseTriggerCoupling
member.summary: Specifies the coupling for the source signal of the trigger if the source is a terminal rather than a virtual channel.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogEdgePauseTriggerCoupling.AC
member.summary: Alternating Current.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogEdgePauseTriggerCoupling.DC
member.summary: Direct Current.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogWindowPauseTriggerCondition
member.summary: Specifies whether the task pauses while the trigger signal is inside or outside the window you specify with WindowBottom and WindowTop.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogWindowPauseTriggerCondition.InsideWindow
member.summary: Pause the measurement or generation while the trigger is inside the window.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogWindowPauseTriggerCondition.OutsideWindow
member.summary: Pause the measurement or generation while the signal is outside the window.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogWindowPauseTriggerCoupling
member.summary: Specifies the coupling for the source signal of the terminal if the source is a terminal rather than a virtual channel.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogWindowPauseTriggerCoupling.AC
member.summary: Alternating Current.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogWindowPauseTriggerCoupling.DC
member.summary: Direct Current.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalLevelPauseTriggerCondition
member.summary: Specifies whether the task pauses while the signal is high or low.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalLevelPauseTriggerCondition.High
member.summary: High state.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalLevelPauseTriggerCondition.Low
member.summary: Low state.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalPatternPauseTriggerCondition
member.summary: Specifies if the Pause Trigger occurs when the physical channels specified with Source match or differ from the digital pattern specified with Pattern.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalPatternPauseTriggerCondition.PatternMatches
member.summary: Trigger when the physical channels match the specified pattern.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalPatternPauseTriggerCondition.PatternDoesNotMatch
member.summary: Trigger when the physical channels do not match the specified pattern.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ArmStartTriggerType
member.summary: Specifies the type of trigger to use to arm the task for a Start Trigger. If you configure an Arm Start Trigger, the task does not respond to a Start Trigger until the device receives the Arm Start Trigger.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ArmStartTriggerType.DigitalEdge
member.summary: Trigger on a rising or falling edge of a digital signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ArmStartTriggerType.None
member.summary: Disable the trigger.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalEdgeArmStartTriggerEdge
member.summary: Specifies on which edge of a digital signal to arm the task for a Start Trigger.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalEdgeArmStartTriggerEdge.Rising
member.summary: Rising edge(s).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalEdgeArmStartTriggerEdge.Falling
member.summary: Falling edge(s).

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TriggerSynchronizationType
member.summary: Specifies the role of the device in a synchronized system. Setting this value to Master or Slave enables trigger skew correction. If you enable trigger skew correction, set this property to Master on only one device, and set this property to Slave on the other devices.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TriggerSynchronizationType.None
member.summary: Disables trigger skew correction.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TriggerSynchronizationType.Master
member.summary: Device is the source for shared clocks and triggers.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TriggerSynchronizationType.Slave
member.summary: Device uses clocks and triggers from the master device.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WatchdogDOExpirationState
member.summary: Specifies the state to which to set the digital physical channels when the watchdog task expires. You cannot modify the expiration state of dedicated digital input physical channels.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WatchdogDOExpirationState.High
member.summary: Logic high.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WatchdogDOExpirationState.Low
member.summary: Logic low.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WatchdogDOExpirationState.Tristate
member.summary: High-impedance state. You can select this state only on devices with bidirectional lines. You cannot select this state for dedicated digital output lines. On some devices, you can select this value only for entire ports.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WatchdogDOExpirationState.NoChange
member.summary: Do not change the state of the lines. On some devices, you can select this value only for entire ports.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WatchdogExpirationTriggerType
member.summary: Specifies the type of trigger to use to expire a watchdog task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WatchdogExpirationTriggerType.DigitalEdge
member.summary: Trigger on a rising or falling edge of a digital signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WatchdogExpirationTriggerType.None
member.summary: Disable the trigger.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalEdgeWatchdogExpirationTriggerEdge
member.summary: Specifies on which edge of a digital signal to expire the watchdog task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalEdgeWatchdogExpirationTriggerEdge.Rising
member.summary: Rising edge(s).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalEdgeWatchdogExpirationTriggerEdge.Falling
member.summary: Falling edge(s).
